bug.author: casparvl
bug.summary: Pip3 install error for Horovod 0.16.0 with intel compilers
bug.description:
Environment:
Framework: TensorFlow Framework version: 1.13.1 Horovod version: 0.16.0 MPI version: 2018.3.222 CUDA version: 10.0.130 NCCL version: 2.3.5 Python version: 3.6.6 OS and version: RedHatEnterpriseServer 7.5 Compilers: icc version 2018.3.222
Bug report: Running pip3 install horovod fails on the setup.py install: <denchmark-code>Running setup.py install for horovod ... error ...
In file included from horovod/common/timeline.cc(22): horovod/common/timeline.h(60): error: namespace "std" has no member "atomic_bool" std::atomic_bool healthy_{false}; ^
compilation aborted for horovod/common/timeline.cc (code 2) INFO: Unable to build TensorFlow plugin, will skip it. </denchmark-code>
I have noticed that timeline.h does not have an <denchmark-code>#include <atomic> </denchmark-code>
include. I downloaded the Horovod source code, added this include to horovod/common/timeline.h, tarred it again and then installed with <denchmark-code>pip3 install horovod-0.16.0.tar.gz </denchmark-code>
Installation then completes without errors. Suggested solution: Add #include <atomic> to horovod/common/timeline.h.
